thread.title: Malcolm Turnbull to appear on Q & A, ABC confirms | The
thread.title_full: Malcolm Turnbull to appear on Q & A, ABC confirms | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Malcolm Turnbull to appear on Q & A, ABC confirms | The
text:
The headstrong Communications Minister has been coy in confirming whether he will appear on ABC’s controversial Q and A program next week, after Prime Minister Tony Abbott introduced a ban on ministers appearing on the show.
But as far as the public broadcaster is concerned, his appearance is still going ahead.
A press release issued by ABC this morning advertises Mr Turnbull as a starring panelist in an episode that promises to “tackle the big issues”.
The Prime Minister was not impressed with ABC’s decision to have Zaky Mallah on the live program. Source: Twitter
The “captain’s call” to stop government ministers appearing on the political panel show came after the ABC gave a platform to Sydney man Zaky Mallah who was convicted of threatening to kill two ASIO officers and charged with terror offences.
Mr Abbott instructed ministers not to appear on the show after an inquiry was announced, with Agricultural Minister Barnaby Joyce the first to cancel his appearance.
When asked earlier this week whether he would appear on next Monday’s panel, Turnbull cryptically said: “time will tell — stay tuned.”
Tony Abbott has banned government ministers from the panel. Pic: Cameron Richardson Source: News Corp Australia
Barnaby Joyce was the first to have to cancel his spot. Pic: Kym Smith Source: News Corp Australia
While we haven’t been able to confirm with Mr Turnbull’s office whether the minister will in fact don his leather jacket and join the panel, it seems he hasn’t cancelled his appearance. Still there is no guaranteed he won’t.
When asked earlier this week whether he would defy the Prime Minister’s orders and do the show, Mr Turnbull said it would “depend on the circumstances” on the day.
Originally published as Turnbull to defy PM’s Q&A ban?
